instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Intermittent flickering lines across screen and freezing.
threads.message: I have a 2012 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> that Very intermittently will have flickering lines across the screen and sometimes may freeze. Customer says that it happens very quickly and randomly. I myself however didn't experience it until I tilted it backwards from under trackpad. I thought it could be an LCD cable but it doesn't seem to occur when opening and closing the lid. I found that it was mostly happening if I tap fairly hard on the palmrest at either side of trackpad. I thought I had it narrowed down to bottom RAM slot and noticed that the screws attaching that RAM bracket were loose. I tightened them and thought things were all good. It is however back in shop with same complaint and I cant seem to recreate the problem. Any suggestions? As always... Thanks in advance.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Intermittent flickering lines across screen and freezing.
threads.message: Bad RAM slot, usually the one you have to put in first. Max out the working slot.
